inn1.comm: flicked four first ball! Nice start for Pakistan. It was a gentle delivery drifting on to the pads. Thank you says Shafiq, who flicks it past square-leg
Much better delivery this time. It swung away from the off stump and Asad had a tentative poke at it. The keeper collects. AB de Villiers is keeping of course.
pushes this well outside the off stump and the umpire extends his arms
taps the back-of-length delivery towards covers, thinks about the single but his partner tells him to change his mind. Wise decision.
Another wide. Hmm. This one was sprayed down the leg side
Fine delivery this time. Inconsistency rules. This one swings away late from the off and middle line and Asad nudges it to the off side
gets behind the line to push this one wide of mid-on for a single
this one wobbles away from the off stump, left alone
Good delivery: It landed on a length on the middle and off and straightened. That batsman falls over a touch on that front foot and is struck high on the pad
Edged between first and second slip! The last one came in; this one went away with the angle and Shafiq pushed out at it, bat away from the body and got the edge
gets behind the line to keep this one out
beaten again. It lands on a length outside the off stump and slants away; Shafiq pushes inside the line
This one is too wide and Pakistan move up to 12
leans forward to push the full-delivery wide of mid-off for a single
length delivery in the zone outside off stump, left alone
gets forward to push the length delivery to point
around the off stump line, from a length, pushed to the on side
shapes away from the off stump and Asad taps it back down the track
on the middle and off line, worked to square-leg
length delivery around the off stump line and it has been pushed to the off sisde
beaten outside the off stump. It curved away late and Asad pushed out at it but the ball shaped past the edge
around the off stump line, guided to backward point
stretches forward to defend the length delivery to cover
in the corridor outside the off stump, left alone
short in length outside off stump and Hafeez punches it on the up and connects well but hits it straight to cover
short delivery outside the off stump and Hafeez goes for a swat-pull but couldn't get bat to the ball
allows this one to pass through to the keeper
banged in short, around 125 kmph, and Asad was on the front foot but that gentle pace allowed him to swivel and pull past midwicket
gets behind the line of the length delivery and taps it back to the bowler
goes for the yorker and almost gets his man. It swung late on the leg and middle line, Asad was looking to play across the line and edged it to the off
this one moves towards the hips and he clips it behind square-leg region
fullish, driven to left of mid-on where Morne makes a good tumbling stop
drifts to the hips again, tucked to fine-leg region
in the corridor outside the off stump and Asad allows it to pass through to the keeper
closer to the off stump and Asad is beaten, pushing inside the line.
leans forward to push the length delivery to midwicket
length delivery outside off stump and driven to mid-off
short and wide, cut away of the back foot and Miller dives to his right at cover to make a fine stop
overpitched outside off stump and driven to covers for a single
homing in on the off stump, nudged to square-leg
just outside the off stump, tapped to point region
on the off stump line, tilts in, pushed out to the midwicket region
leans forward to defend to the off side
fine shot! It was outside the off stump, punched away wide of third man for a single
Quality shot. He glided forward to unfurl an on drive to collect a boundary
around the off stump line, defended to the off side
off cutter around the middle and off line, defended on the front foot

The bouncer does the trick. Langeveldt had tried it before but Asad Shafiq managed to connect with the pull shot on that occasion. He has the tendency to get on to the front foot a touch too early and hence the bouncers. This time around, Tsotsobe's bouncer came on to him quickly and he was in no position to play that shot. He was late on the pull and ended up swatting it to mid-on.
fullish, on the off and middle line, defended to the off side
in the corridor outside off stump, left alone
leans forward to drive the fullish delivery to covers
in the zone outside the off stump, left alone
just outside the off stump, defended on the front foot
leans forward to tap the ball to extra cover for a quick single
gets forward to push the length delivery to covers
leans forward to tap the incoming length delivery back down the pitch
stays back to work this back-of-length delivery to covers
full delivery, dug out towards point and Duminy makes a tumbling stop
cuts away from the off stump, pushed out to short cover
Dropped by Kallis at short cover. Very tough. Hafeez drove the length delivery away from the body and it flew over Kallis who stretched his hand out but couldn't hold on
gets forward to push it to extra cover for a single
Gorgeous quality hit. He glided forward, held his balance, and punched the back-of-length delovery on the up and through covers.
fuller and well outside off, AB collects
Top shot! it was short in length and outside off, Hafeez stood up tall, rode the bounce well and punched it neatly through point.

Whack! Width on offer this time and Hafeez lashed it over backward point. Amla charged across from third man and nearly stopped it .. but his feet were over the boundary ropes when he pushed ball back in second time. He gets up and signals to the umpire that it's a four
Classy! It was a length delivery outside off stump and Hafeez stretched forward to play a fine on-the-up drive through extra cover
And lets this one go through to the keeper
cuts in from outside off, punched to mid-off
moves in from outside off stump, defended to the off side
leans forward to defend the length delivery to the off side
shortish delivery in the zone outside off, left alone
gets forward to square drive the length delivery to Kallis who mops up at sweeper cover
just outside the off stump line, pushed out to cover
Lashed away! Overpitched and width on offer and Hafeez plays the lofted square drive., a shot that Younis Khan plays with aplomb. This one flew over point
clips this short-of-length delivery past square-leg for a single
gets behind the line of this length delivery and taps it back to the bowler
slower, off cutter outside off stump, pushed out to point
cuts in to the middle and leg line, clipped past square-leg
kicks up from short of length, Younis Khan taps it to the off side
the slower one this time and Younis Khan defends it back down the track
another slower one, another off cutter, tapped to the on side
the short delivery and Hafeez pulls it to deep square-leg region. 50 up for PAkistan
a bouncer on the middle and leg line, Younis shapes for the pull but it climbs more than he anticipated and ends up swatting it to backward square-leg
on the middle and leg line, clipped away to long leg for a single
Full in length and on the middle and leg, Younis allowed it to come before he rolled his wrists and glanced it to the fine-leg boundary. Very neatly done
leans forward to tap the slower one to the off side
full in length, on the middle, on driven wide of mid-on for 2 runs
the off cutter outside off stump, tapped past backward point
the bouncer outside off stump, Younis stays beside the line and runs it down to third man
Crunched! It was a touch wide, it was a bit short and Hafeez got back and across to cut it to the point boundary
fuller, around the off stump line, tapped towards mid-on for a single
slower one, the off cutter on the middle stump line, eased to the on side
Another slower one, nudged to the on side and they will take the single
tossed up full outside off stump, on driven to long-on
turns in from outside off stump, steered to backward point
stretches well forward to pinch a single to cover point
slower, wider outside off, Younis waited on the front foot and then tried to cut it but no wood on leather
fuller, around off stump line, flicked to deep midwicket
turns from outside off, steered to short third man
off cutter around the off stump, Younis mistimes the drive to mid-on
shortish delivery outside off, punched to sweeper cover
slower one, fullish outside off, tapped to the on side
slower one, fullish, on driven to long-on for a single
shortish, on the pads, glanced down to fine-leg region
flighted on the off stump line, eased past midwicket for a single
leans forward to tap it back to the bowler
looped across outside off, driven past the diving Botha for a single to long-off
square drives this one to deep-point region for a single
rushes down the track but Botha slows up the pace and forces Hafeez to lunge out and push the ball to the on side. Duminy rushes from midwicket to kill the single
brings the 50 of the partnership with a wristy dab past Duminy
fullish outside off stump, driven hard but straight to mid-off
slower one, loopy full toss and Hafiz drives it straight to cover. And he is not too happy with his shot; thinks he should have put that full toss to the boundary
walks down the track and receives another slower one; he adjusts to defend it
length delivery outside off, run down to third man
really full delivery outside off, pushed out towards mid-off
gets forward to on drive to long-on for a single
from round the stumps, just outside off, late cut to left of short third man
leans forward to tap the off break - this one was bowled from over the wicket - to the leg side
sweeps this to deep square-leg region. Catch it was the cry but it didn't carry to Langeveldt
goes right back to wrist this behind square-leg
gets forward to on drive to long-on for yet another single
backs away to cut it to deep point and by the time Amla moves across from sweeper cover they run two
gets forward to clip this to midwicket
Bosh! Very neatly done. It was the short delivery and he was on the front foot but there wasn't much pace on the ball and he swiveled to pull it to the midwicket boundary
the slower one outside off... Hafeez went for the big heave-ho but didn't connect
gets forward to push this slower one to mid-off for a quick single
gets forward to drive but ends up mistiming; it was the slower one. Younis shakes his head and practices that shot again
leans forward to push the ball past the non-striker for a single
works this off break past square-leg for a single
slower, stretches forward to wrist it from around the off stump line to square-leg
backs away to cut from the line of the off and middle stumps. It turned in and he cut it past point
works this off break to short mdiwicket
quicker, on the off-stump line, tapped past point
turns in to the leg stump line, Hafeez was backing away, got cramped by the turn and pushed it to the on side
starts off with a wide from round the stumps
not a wide this time but its around the leg-stump line and Younis helps it along to fine-leg region
quicker, on the leg and middle line, pushed past midwicket for a single. 100 up and the crowd cheer
on that leg and middle line again, flicked past square-leg for a single
he picks it from around the off stump line and sweeps it for a single
on the off stump line again, defended on the front foot

Loud shout for lbw but it was turned down. Close call that. It landed on the off and middle and straightened . Younis Khan tried to work it across the line and was hit on the pad. Will confirm how close it was after a replay. The predictive eye says that was out..
leanes forward to defend to the off side
.taps this to the on side
around the off stump line, late cut past short third man
works this past square-leg for a single
leans forward to on drive to long-on
goes for the sweep and top edges it but it lands safely past square-leg
on the middle and leg line, fullish, flicked away to deep square-leg. That's the fifty for Hafeez. A very pleasing knock so far.
outside the off stump line, guided to third man for a single
moves forward to push the length delivery to the off side
length delivery outside off stump, steered to point
sprays this down the leg side ..
length delivery outside off, mistimes the drive to the off side
And it's another wide down the leg side. AB collects.
length delivery outside off, kicks up, Younis punches it past point
flighted on middle and he drives it down to long-off off the front foot
ooh, Hafeez is early into the drive to another flighted ball, nearly chips it back to Duminy. Lands just short
works it with the turn from leg stump towards square leg
straighter this time and Hafeez defends down the track
tossed up outside off and driven to mid off.

edged and perilously close to Kallis. It was looped outside off and Hafeez went for the cut, but got a thick edge that took it higher and finer than he would have liked. It flew to the left of Kallis who hurried across from short third man and hurled himself upwards and to the right to pluck it, but it landed just out of his reach
tossed up and turning down the leg, Younis calmly works it square for one
flighted outside off and Hafeez takes the challenge to drive against the spin and into the covers. Done well, got to the pitch and kept it along the ground to pick two
this time he drops short and Hafeez goes back to cut it behind point for one
Botha spears it on middle and Younis looks to work it off the pads, but misses. Rapped on the pads, but it was surely going down the leg
this time he manages to get bat on the nurdle and picks a single towards square leg
flighted on leg and Younis chips out for the on drive. Can't get it past mid-on though
stays in the crease but reaches out to work it with the spin to the left of mid on

Duminy has had Hafeez in trouble twice in two balls now. Flighted outside off and Hafeez again tries to take the aerial route, but ends up hitting that carve over the off side too low on the bat. There was absolutely no timing on it and that saved him as Amla coming in from the deep could not reach it despite diving forward
worked for a single, and that's the 100-run stand between these two. Younis ticks on with the precision of a Swiss watch.
sliding down the leg and worked with the spin towards square leg for one more
flicks this one powerfully wide of mid on and picks another single
slides down the leg and the keeper can't collect
drives against the spin into the covers and picks a single
shot in anger, looks to come out and go over the top but can't quite get the elevation and he picks a single down the ground
flighted on leg and he goes for the sweep, good work at square leg to keep it to one
drives this with the spin towards square leg. Each of the last four overs have yielded five
Duminy drifts onto the pads with the spin and it is calmly placed towards square leg for a couple
this time, Duminy pushes it on off stump and Hafeez opens the face deftly to pick runs on the off side
worked behind square on the leg side for one more. Younis is working the angles brilliantly
pre-meditated paddle sweep, but executed to perfection there. It was full on middle and he was ready to lap it very fine for a couple
drives a very full ball straight to mid on
full again but on off stump and he drives it into the covers to retain strike
turns and goes down the leg with the angle as Hafeez misses the sweep.

well, Hafeez was threatening to give Duminy his wicket, but in the end it is Botha who prises it out. It is again wide outside off and he again cuts uppishly. Langeveldt from short third man skips across to his right and pouches it nicely as he tumbles across. Well played by Hafeez, think the heat and humidity might have affected his concentration.
Misbah shuffles across and glances Botha with the spin fine of short fine leg. Smith runs back, slides and releases quickly  to keep them down to one
back of a length on off stump and Younis settles to defend down the track
fuller and sparred on to the pads and Younis tickes it round the corner for one
slower, loopier and fuller on middle, Misbah takes it on the full and taps to long on for one more
straightens from leg stump, Misbah deftly tucks it with the spin behind square for one
well fielder by Duminy. Younis looked to drive it to his right, but Duminy pranced across and stopped it
full outside off and Younis unfurls a powerful sweep, but can't beat deep square leg
Misbah works it from middle and leg towards midwicket for one
Flicked powerfully from middle and leg wide of long on for a couple. Younis puts his hands up, and looks down. This means a lot to him, and it is a fine fifty

goes off side this time and again, lovely timing and placement. Tossed up outside off and Younis was up to the challenge of driving against the spin into the gap at deep extra cover. Tsotsobe covers it after running across from long off, but they run two
tossed up on off and Misbah nurdles it with the spin through mid on in a manner that would do Moin Khan proud
shorter and Younis goes back and looks to punch through mid on. Finds the gap for one
works it from middle and leg to square leg, but can't find the gap
Misbah does it again, all wrists there as he turns it from off stump towards wide mid on for an easy single
full on the pads and Younis will not be pleased with the fact that he flicked it straight to midwicket in the circle
holds it back and turns it in from outside off. Younis reaches out into the forward defensive
back of a length outside off and Misbah opens the face to run it towards third man for one
angles into Younis from outside off and he stays back in the crease to defend back to the bowler
this time Morne slides on to the pads and Younis works it with the angle to wide long on for one
drops it short outside off and MIsbah rides the bounce and tries to steer it square. Can't get it past point, but he had that well under control
again short, but coming into the batsman at 128 kph and it is punched into the covers
another bouncer and this angles into Misbah's body and allows him to roll his wrists over a controlled pull. Single down to square leg
back of a length on off stump and Misbah punches straight to mid on
skips out this time, but is defeated by Botha's subtle changes in flight. Manages to shovel it with the spin, but straight ti midwicket
short this time and Misbah makes sure he punches it to the left of mid on for one
full and flat on off stump, Botha is conscious to not give Younis any room or width and gets the result. Younis defends

gone. Botha nails Younis on the sweep. That was tossed up, landed outside off and was turning in as Younis reached across to sweep. He missed and it rapped him on the pads. Was it hitting outside the line of off? Replays suggest it hit Younis just outside the line of off. Asad Rauf doesn't think so. Well played Younis, but this is a huge moment in this game.
tossed up on off and turning away, Alam reaches forward and defends. Botha's spotless spell comes to an end.
back of a length outside off and Misbah runs it fine to third man for one.
kicks up on the middle and leg line, Fawad was surprised by the extra bounce; he hopped to jab it to the on side
slightly slower outside off and the keeper collects
leans forward to tap the length delivery to the off

run out chance flicked towards short midwicket where Botha stops and fires a throw at the non-striker's end .. Had it hit - it bounced just over - it could have been touch and go for Alam who had backed up too far
wrists this one to deep square-leg region for couple of runs
around the off-stump line, rolls away of the edge to third man. Partly steered, partly edged
slower, off cutter on the off and middle line, punched back to the bowler
topedged pull but it lands safely much ahead of Amla at deep square-leg region. It was the bouncer and Misbah was late on the pull
fullish, on the leg stump line, pushed to left of smith at mid-on for a quick single. Smith fired the throw and missed the stumps but Fawad was just home
just outside the off stump, stabbed to point
slower off cutter, misbah goes back to punch it to long-on
around the off-stump line, pushed out to point region

Misbah holes out to deep  square-leg. He went for the big hit and swung it straight to the fielder. Tsotsobe celebrates. Pakistan are wobbling a touch and Shahid Afridi walks in. Misbah tried to lift it much straighter but ended up dragging it over square-leg
short delivery outside off, steered to thirdman
around the off-stump line, run down to third man
Five down. They were 140 for 1; now they are 167 for 5. Collapse time. It was a length delivery and Afridi went for the big hit over the infield but lifted it straight to mid-off. Gone!
slants this across Razzaq who allows it to go through to the keeper
lands outside leg, moves towards middle, jabbed to covers for a single. It would have got really tight had Miller picked up the ball ..
just outside the off stump, punched to point
the bouncer on the middle and leg line and Razzaq ducks
slower off cutter, driven to sweeper cover
shuffles across and pushes the length delivery to cover
the slow off cutter, just outside off, tapped to point for a single
outside the off stump, pushed through point
nice little slower one, full and Razzaq is in trouble: he checked his drive and the ball ballooned towards mid-on but fell well short of the fielder
leans across to square drive to left of backward point where Duminy make a nice diving half-stop

Lovely catch from AB. Tsotsobe, who had a good Twenty20 series, is doing it again in the ODIs. It straightened around off and middle from short of lengthand Razzaq was surprised; he hopped up and stabbed out at it and got the inner edge. AB de Villiers dived to his left to take it. Pakistan crumbling here.
kicks up at the body, clipped behind square-leg for a single
fullish outside off stump, pushed out to backward point
leans forward to defend to the off
just outside the off stump, run down to third man
on the pads, clipped wide of midwicket for a single
on the pads, clipped to Amla at deep square-leg for a single

Does anyone get surprised anymore with these collapses? Comfortably Numb. This one lands on a length on the middle and moves towards the off stump. Fawad Alam didn't do much to prevent it from going towards its destination; he crouched and stabbed at it but the ball escaped his poor attempts, to stop it, collided with the inside edge and fell on the off stump. Clatter.
leans forward to defend to the off side
pushes inside the line and the ball slants away to AB
allows this one to go through to the keeper as well
And again.

flies past the diving AB de Viliers and Kallis makes a diving stop near the third man boundary. The umpire says no runs as he had not played a shot at it .. It landed around the leg stump line and moved towards middle, the batsman took the bat inside the line and the ball flew through to hit the waist .. And it went past AB
leans forward to defend to the off side
the slow cutter around the off stump and Zulqarnain squeezes it to the off
gets forward to nudge it to the on side
fullish, pushed to left of mid-on for a single
cuts in from around off stump, steered down to third man
length delivery around the off stump line, pushed out to point
the bouncer outside off stump, left alone
pushes this wide outside the off stump
straightens on the off stump line, Zulqarnain pushed inside the line and squeezed the ball out to point
outside the off stump, run down to third man
leans forward to work it past square-leg
kicks up from short of length, jabbed out to point
fuller outside off, pushed out to cover
And then they were two. It was the slower one, a length delivery in the corridor outside off stump and Gul had a fatal poke at it. Edge and gone.
sharp bouncer and the batsman takes evasive action. The ball collides with the right shoulder and flies over AB for 4 leg byes
length delivery around off, guided to Duminy at backward point
in the zone outside off stump and the ball moves past the defensive poke
on the middle and leg, tapped to square-leg
here comes the bouncer, Ajmal is in trouble, takes his eyes of the ball but goes through with the pull and top edges it .. lands safe, though
cuts in from outside off, guided to third man
stretches well forward to ease this one to cover
around the off-stump line, tapped to backward point
landed just outside leg and moved in to hit the pad in front of the middle. The batsman was trying to defend but played all around it. Shout for lbw but it pitched outside leg
moves down the track, gets outside the leg and slices the length delivery in the air and to the left of Smith at mid-off
shortish, swatted past square-leg for a single
fullish and outside the leg stump .. tries to flick but doesn't connect. Must have brushed the pad or the boot
leans across to push the length delivery to covers
just outside off stump, pushed to point
in the zone outside off, goes for the cut  but is cramped for room and is beaten
Hello! He went down the track, got a short ball and tried to pull it. He ended up chopping it down and it went of the bottom edge and bounced behind the wicket
guides this to third man for a single
cut away past point

Ajmal is run out. It was chopped to right of third man where Kallis stopped and fired an accurate throw to AB who broke the stumps. Ajmal couldn't reach in time. The third umpire pressed the wrong button initially and flashed not out before he corrected it.
in the zone outside off and it flies past the edge
slower one in the channel outside off and Shoaib is beaten
jumps from short of length and Shoaib sways away
another bouncer and Shoaib sways away again
moves outside leg and goes  for a big lofted shot over the off-side field but makes no contact
around the off, punched to cover
backs away to punch this to sweeper cover
Wallop! The crowd roar! Shoaib gives them a reason to laugh and cheer with a thump over long-off. He moved outside leg and whacked it hard
swing and a miss! He goes for a big hit but makes no contact
moves outside leg, Langeveldt pushes it wide outside off and Shoaib can't reach it

Pakistan all out 203. They lost 9 wickets in the space of 63 runs. Shoaib went for the slog and top-edged it to wide mid-off where Miller settled under the ball. A smiling Tsotsobe leads the South Africans off the field.

inn2.comm: short in length, moves towards the off stump, pushed to the off from the back foot. It was around 137 kmph delivery. Two slips in place
drifts to the pads and Smith clips it past square-leg for couple of runs
around the off-stump line and it runs down to third man for a single
Ouch! Amla is hit by the bouncer. It was around 140kmph and it burst up .. Amla got the wrists down and the bat out of the harm's way and was hit on the left shoulder.
pushes this to extra cover for a single
in the zone outside off, Smith stays back and punches it nicely and it bounces over backward point where Alam stretches his hand out to make a half-stop.
fullish around the off stump, Smith was late in getting forward and eventually does so but what he does even better was to push it with a full bat-face ... and the ball races through mid-off
lands back of length and Smith stays back to tap the delivery to the on side.
pushes this across Smith who lets the keeper collect it
presses back to push the length delivery to cover
in the zone outside off, pushed out to covers again
lands outside off and moves away, left alone
full in length and moves in towards off stump, Amla gets the bat down in a hurry to drive and the ball flies of the inside edge to backward square-leg
another good delivery; in the channel outside off and Smith was beaten, trying to drive on the up
lands around leg stump, moves in towards middle and Smith clips it through midwicket for three runs
Thwack! It was the bouncer just outside off but Amla was ready for it and cracked it over midwicket in style. Pulled away.
That furious bat-speed of Amla again. He flashed this fuller length delivery to backward point where Fawad Alam makes a diving half-stop
fullish, on the middle and off, pushed to left of mid-off
on the pads, wristed through midwicket and they run hard to complete three runs
full in length outside off, punched to Asad at cover
in the channel around that off stump, tapped to Younis at short extra cover
slightly slower, close to the off stump and Smith pushes outside the line of the ball. Zulqarnain collects.
fuller, wider, driven to mid-off
pushes it across Smith who tries to cut but no wood on leather
length delivery homing in on the off stump, Amla went for the square drive and the ball skids on quickly and runs of the outer edge to third man
Quality strike: it was a length delivery outside off and Smith glides forward to punch it on the up and through covers
from round the stumps now, length delivery around off, Smith again punches on the up but this time straight to cover

Amla is almost run out.  It was a quick bouncer, Smith was late on the pull and he jabbed it to square-leg. Asad threw the ball at the non-striker's end where Amla had backed up too far ... he ran between the stumps and the throw and managed to get back. The ball rolled past the stumps. Meanwhile, Smith is in pain. That bouncer hit him flush on the gloves. He has already had lots of problems with injuries to his hands. This one struck him on the left hand. The magic spray is out now.
another fiery bouncer, on the middle and off this time, smith stayed beside the line and guided it to third man
from over the wicket to Amla: A short point is in place. It's a length delivery on the middle and off and its pushed back to Shoaib who threatens to throw it back but holds on to the ball.

Dropped by Zulqarnain, is it?  Smith shaped to defend and pushed outside the line of the ball. It clipped the inner edge and went to the right of the keeper. Zulqarnain didn't even move his gloves. He didn't expect that inner edge. Don't think it hit his gloves.
slip in place and Kallis drives so pleasingly through extra cover. He leaned forward to caress it
around off stump line, on driven to long-on
edged wide of the first slip. It skidded on just outside off and AMla tried to off drive and got the edge to third man
leans forward to unfurl a fine on drive between the bowler and the mid-on fielder (Razzaq) and it races away to the boundary. Should Razzaq have thrown in a dive?
nudges this one wide of midwicket
fullish, on the middle, Amla is late on it and mistimes it to the leg side.
Fullish and Amla is in trouble again. He inside edges the off drive to his pad.
pushes this length delivery to cover
the slower one, nice one and Amla too picks it up and defends it to the off
This is a good shot; that fast bat-speed and the ball flies to left of backward point where Fawad stops it
No ball for the height. The beamer. Accidental one. It was the slower one that went wrong. It looped over Amla and bounced before it reached the keeper.
fullish delivery outside off, Amla gets another inside edge on the off drive
Tonked! It was the slower one, full, but Amla picked it early and absolutely smashed it over long-off.
slider but wide down the leg side
fullish, on the leg, slower, pushed back to the bowler
skids on quickly towards middle and leg, pushed out to midwicket
this one is slower and it turns away from Kallis who gets an inside edge on the defensive poke. The ball goes to short fine-leg region
leans forward to push it to cover
fullish, on the middle, driven down to long-off
leans forward to wrist this past square-leg
from round the stumps on the middle, worked through midwicket
around the off stump line, pushed back to the bowler
on the middle stump line, pushed back to the bowler
around the off, pushed back to Ajmal
moves down the track and whips it to deep square-leg
on the middle and leg line, worked to right of short midwicket where Afridi makes a diving stop
leans forward to push to cover
leans forward to drive it back to Afridi
on the middle stump line, tapped to the off
moves outside leg and mistimes the drive back to teh bwoler
taps this towards Ajmal at mid-on for a quick single
slider on the pads, jabbed away to the on side
top spinner from round the stumps, pushed back down the track
moves down the track and is hit on the pad, trying to tap it to the on side. It was the toppie.. it would have missed the off
around that leg stump line, rolls away of the pad
flighted slowly on the middle, turns in, pushed to midwicket
this one broke away from the off stump, shortish as well, Kallis reached out for the square cut and it runs partly of the edge to third man
leans forward to defend to the off
leans forward to cover drive to sweeper cover
gets forward to drive down to long-off

the quickish slider on the off stump line, fine delivery actually, but Amla does even better; he presses back to cut it through point. Afridi can't believe it. It was purely possible because of Amla's furious bat speed
slower, rolls away behind square-leg
And Kallis too runs across for a leg bye.
short in length, pulled to deep midwicket for a single
leans forward to off drive to long-off
from round the stumps, around the off stump, eased back to the bowler
on the middle stump line, worked wide of mid-on for a single

It was around the off-stump line and Amla pressed back in a hurry as the ball skidded on. The bat came down but the ball skidded on quicker. Have to see the replay to really see where it hit him. So please to wait. Amla wasn't too happy with the verdict. Hawk eye shows that it would have hit the off stump of Amla. It landed on the middle and skidded on towards the off. It also kept a touch low.
Leading edge over mid-off!  He went down the track but was beaten in the flight and also, didn't pick the toppie. He tried to lift it over mid-on and it went just over mid-off and it then races away
leans forward to tap this to the on side
full and straight, nudged to square-leg
leans forward to to drive to long-off
gets forward to edge the drive to the leg side
leans across to tap this to the off
skips down the track for the off drive and edges to short fine-leg
fine delivery; the quickish slider on the middle, Kallis went for the off drive and got the inside edge to fine-leg region
works this to the on side for a single. Well may be not. No run
works this one wide of midwicket and will get that single
short in length, punched past Alam at point
this one straightens outside off from a length, kallis is beaten, pushing inside the line.
short in length, punched to deep point
back of length outside off, punched to cover
98.1 kmph quickish skidder! Kallis manages to keep it out
ah! this one is a lot slower ... defended to the off
leans forward to drive to long-off
slowish, turns from the middle and off line, guided to cover point
around the off stump line, leg break, Kallis adjusts his hands and taps it to slip
the quicker slider but goes down leg and hits the pad
Bouncer, says Gul. Take that, says AB. Not enough effort on that, it finishes as a half-tracker around waist height and AB despatches it with disdain through midwicket

what ever it is AB has had for drinks, I want that. Moves forward in pleasing fluidity to take that length ball on off stump on the rise and caress it through the covers. Everything right about that shot
Gul responds with the slow off cutter at 102 kph, AB goes back in the crease and taps it off the hips for a single to square leg
back of a length at 133 kph and Kallis stays back to defend it with the full face
now he looks to improvise, Kallis skips forward and across, but still can't get to the length of a shortish delivery. Plays it into the covers
133 kph, and a well-directed bouncer, Kallis takes on the challenge and goes for the hook, but makes no contact. Just as well, he did not seem fully in control
full on middle and off, AB reaches out to defend
slightly short and wide, enough for AB to open the face and nurdle it to point for one
back of a length and hurries into Kallis who comes forward when he should have been back. Inside edged into the pads

lovely bowling and drops just short of Younis diving to his left at slip. Afridi slows it up and gives it revolutions to turn it sharply away from Kallis who looked to drive without getting entirely forward. Kissed the outside edge and popped fine of Younis, who made a good effort but could not latch on
full on leg this time and Kallis looks to drive inside out. Can't get it past cover
this time he tries to go leg side and plays it straight to mid on. Very good over from Afridi, this. They need a lot more of this, do Pakistan
slows it up and flights it on off, AB reaches out to smother it as it turns in
chips out this time but Ajmal holds it back and AB can't get to the pitch of it, plays around it and keeps it out
drift and turn, from off to leg as AB looks to whip off the pads and misses
slightly shorter and AB works it with the spin towards midwicket for one
here comes the doosra, goes on straight after coming in with the angle and Kallis was feeling for it from the crease. Inside edged to square leg for one
full on middle and leg, AB punches it down the ground for one to long on.
AB prances out and plays it back to Afridi who thinks of shying at the stumps as AB scrambles back
the quicker one, no turn, just hurtles into AB's pads from middle and off and he squeezes it out to the covers off the back foot
a rare gift from Afridi and AB tucks in. Chips out, takes the full toss on the full and swipes it through midwicket. Easily done.
looks to work it to the leg side, but can't get it away for runs
and again, AB chips out, Afridi sees him and pulls it back but AB's big strides help him to take it as a half volley and whip it wide of mid on for four more. Excellent shot.
chips out again, but can't get to the pitch this time
Kallis shuffles across and takes it from the off stump line and works it tom midwicket for one
full on off and middle, AB drives it easily to long on
Kallis is again feeling for it without getting fully forward, is his footwork being hampered by the cramps? Pops off the inside edge towards midwicket, for one more
hurries AB with a quicker one and he stays back in the crease to make something out of it. No luck
the straighter one again, but looked like AB spotted it and dabbed it with the turn by opening the face to send it behind point
flighted offie on off stump to Kallis who looks to shuffle across and ease it fine with the spin. Can't get it away though
fired in short at 93.7 kph on leg stump and AB pulls it to deep square leg for one
slower and fuller to Kallis who again is not very comfortable getting forward as he looks to defend
this one kicks up from a length and Kallis pulls away the bottom hand as he defends from the crease
gets a single this time by going back and working it from off and middle to the leg side
slider outside off and AB does well to connect with a late glide, but can't beat short third man
shooter flies down the leg and Haider does really well to pouch it as he dived across. Would Kamran Akmal have been able to stop that.
tossed up outside off and AB looks for the glide again and misses
flighted just outside off and Kallis is in agony as he goes on a knee, looking to sweep. He misses by a whisker, ball misses off stump by lesser and Kallis feels his toe. He smiles.
comes half forward and defends to the off side this time
makes contact with the sweep and nearly sends it straight to square leg, but it landed a couple of feet in front of him
quicker to AB on middle and leg and he punches through long on to one
glances this one with the turn fine. Kallis comes back for two, so that's good news from a fitness point of view
doosra outside off, but short enough for Kallis to spot and work off the face for a single behind square.
tossed up on off and AB pushes it into the covers for one
Afridi goes wide on the crease and spears it into leg stump and gets it to straighten. Kallis reaches out and defends
and again, marginally shorter, but the intent is to get Kallis to lunge forward and defend
back of a length outside off and Kallis defends again off front foot
gets it away into the covers this time and picks a single
AB skips out and works him from middle and leg, wide of mid on for one
back of a length outside off and AB defends after getting half forward, not much pace on that first ball
more effort, 138 kph but finishes on the pads and AB deflects it square for one
short and wide outside off and called wide. Shoaib will have to go back a mile and rebowl that one
back of a length outside off and Kallis stabs it off the backfoot for one
chopped into the ground as Shoaib again gives him width outside off. They pick a couple
well bowled, lands it in the corridor, on the neither here nor there length. AB reaches out and drives from memory, it misses the outside edge and whistles past him to Haider
width on offer again and AB chops it away square for one more
holds it back, but lands it on leg stump and AB works it wide of mid on for one
Kallis clips a full delivery on his toes square for another single
nicely done. Fawad Alam jumps across from midwicket to his right to haul in a crisp flick from AB
tosses it up on off stump and AB comes down the track and works it straight back to Afridi who holds on without shying at the stumps
works it to the leg side off the back foot and turns the strike over again
Kallis picks a single by turning it off the pads to short fine leg. Afridi's spell is over. Blik and you would have missed it
Shoaib huffs and puffs and grunts as he puts in a lot of effort in that back of a length ball outside off, it is worked with an open face, square for one
wide of off again and AB goes back in the crease to unfurl an elegant square cut. Two runs taken before the sweeper intervenes
effort bouncer, 144 kph and really lifts at AB who rolls the wrists on the pull anfd ensures he kept it down. Single to midwicket
Kallis plays a nice looking cover drive, still not getting as forward as he should, but he is getting as forward as he can. Bisects the gap inside the circle and the sweeper cover fields it
AB is early on the drive this time to a delivery at 134 kph and ends up checking his shot to the off side. Shoaib fields on his follow through
AB cracks another square cut, off the front foot and in front of square, but there is a sweeper cover to deny him four
gentle delivery landed short of a length on off stump, AB jumps out and works it to the leg side for one
fuller on Kallis' pads who nearly holed out to deep square leg, who in turn nearly over ran the ball as it spun away fromhim. Single taken in the end
short of a length and AB this time advances down the track and looks to work it to the leg side. Ends up playing it straight and mid on cleans up
ah, jags this one into AB's pads at 121 kph and the batsman seemed to have been caught unawares by the change in length. Squeezed off the inside edge behind square
pulls it clean as a whistle from off stump line. Everything looking good in that shot, except that it went straight as a tack to midwicket
works a fuller ball off middle and leg, straight to mid on
straightens from middle and off as Kallis reaches across and works across the line for one

another good shot from AB who reaches fifty with a majestic trot down the track. He gets to the pitch and whips Ajmal with the spin  through wide long on. Always along the ground, always headed to the boundary. She absolutely purred away.
slips down the leg and it is called a wide

Ajmal does him in with another drifter that holds its line. AB chipped out, but was just a foot short of getting to the pitch. That was all it needed for Ajmal's floater to do the trick as it held the line and took the outside half of Ajmal's bat as he went through with the drill-flick. Came back at the rate of knots to Ajmal who did well to hold on. Nicely done.
Duminy gets  adoosra first-up - remember his ntravails against Harbhajan from round the wicket in India? - just about manages to keep it off as it breaks in sharply.
off spinner, shorter on off and Duminy goes back to work it square for one
floater that goes across Kallis, but short enough for him to spot it and stab a single behind square on the leg side
Razzaq drifts into Kallis' pads and he whips him square for another single
short and angling across JP who looks to work it square by poking from the back foot. Straight to Alam at point who shies at the bowlers' end where Kallis is thinking of a single
fuller and JP gets forward to drive into the covers. Can't find the gap
slowish off cutter, 119 kph and JP goes back to play it with the turn to third man. Delicate sleight of hand for a single

everything about that was languid. Razzaq sends another nothing ball on Kallis' pads, who essays a workman-like flick into the vast vacant region at midwicket. Ajmal tagged it all along, slow and steady, and refused to dive to haul it in. Kallis is tired and on his haunches again.
more crisply flicked this time, but it is fielded by midwicket running across to his right. Single taken.

Christmas comes early for Kallis as Ajmal over-does the flight and offers a friendly full toss on middle. Kallis spent some time thinking where to go, decided on midwicket and carted it there with a nice slog sweep. One bounce four.
turns in from well outside off as Kallis reaches out and tries to work it around. Haider hows out an appeal for something. No one else cares.
very fast faster one, 98 kph and hurries into Kallis' pads. He works it with the pace to midwicket
a hint of room outside off and Kallis stays back to run it off the face for a single through point
flighted on middle and leg to Duminy who again reaches out and feels with the bat in front of pads. Manages to cover the trajectory this time
shorter on the pads and he comfortably tucks it square for a single
length ball on off stump and JP punches it with the full face straight to mid off
short and angling across JP who stays back and dabs it through backward point for one
strays into Kallis' pads yet again and he picks it up off the pads. Good old heave ho, but cannot beat deep square leg
deftness personified is Duminy as he stays back and opens the face to send a ball an inch outside off stump to third man for one
slower ball on off stump and Kallis sees it coming. Waits and taps it to the leg side from the off side for another single.
ounches a length ball to mid off for none
turning down the leg and Kallis dabs it with the spin, straight to short fine leg
lands this one on off stump and Kallis works it with the spin wide of mid on for one,
turns away from middle and off, JP covers the deviation and plays it into the covers for one
length ball on middle and off, Kallis defends stoutly down the track
Kallis brings up his 79th fifty, and given the circumstances, one must say well played. Works one on the pads towards midwicket - he has done that all day - and gets another single
that's the ball, the doosra hurrying in, that Duminy does not like. He had no clue about it and somehow squeezed it from the crease, off the inside edge
full on off stump and Kallis drills it nicely, straight to mid off
slower ball, slips down the leg and it is called wide

Well, that's not the first time Razzaq has offered Kallis a leg stump gift, but that is the first time Kallis has made full use of it. Gets half forward and swings that with the angle, off the pads, over the long on boundary skirting that is pulled in. It would have carried anyway.

he's had enough of the singles, has Kallis. Another over-pitched ball on middle and off, Kallis comes forward, shows the full bat face, holds the pose as the ball soars straight over the bowler, bounces a couple of times and reaches the boundary
Razzaq shortens the length and Kallis eases it behind square for another single
Duminy stays in the crease and defends a ball angling across from leg to off, into the covers
punched wide of cover and they scamper across for a single
fired in on leg and Duminy stays back to defend down the pitch
airy shot from Duminy, wafting at it as it turns across from middle. Misses the edge
he doesn't quite fancy off spin does he? Trots out, gets too close to the ball and ends up unable to loft it leg side.
more in control this time, drives with the spin into the covers
works it to the leg side this time, can't get it past midwicket
and lets the last one go outside off. A rare maiden as Ajmal finishes his spell. Not enough runs to work with, but well bowled.
starts with a slower ball outside off and Kallis is early in the shot as he looks to cut it, and nearly chops it back onto the stumps. Runs off the boot to the off side for one
quicker and fuller on the pads and JP squirts it out to mid on and scrambles across for a single

Kallis essays a crisp little pull shot and while everyone else enjoys the timing, placement and utter ruthlessness of the shot, Kallis goes down, writhing in pain, holding the thigh as he crumpled. His face is contorted in pain as he stretches and tries to reach the toes. He is down for the count here
back of a length outside off and Ingram goes back to defend to the off side
opens the face to glide a length ball outside off towards third man for one
short ball, angling across JP from leg to off as he looks to swing it across the line into the deep midwicket are. Misses making contact though.
134 kph, length ball on leg stump and coming in towards off, chipped off the backfoot towards square leg
Ingram opens the face and deflects Shoaib with the pace towards third man for another single
good, nasty bouncer from Shoaib, 142 kph and JP tooks his eyes off and took it on the gloves. Not the best technique in dealing with that
closer to him this time and JP is more comfortable in defence, going back and keeping it out with full face
runs another single off the face towards third man, does Ingram
another bouncer handled badly. Hmm, fended away as if he were dealing with a fly rather a five ounce red cherry hurtling across at 145 kph. Manages to keep it away though, to square leg
works it from outside off with the angle for a single
better from Ingram who gets under the bouncer and lets it go. No periscope dangling either

that sums it up. Ingram crunches out a nice little cover drive and Asad Shafiq, running across a mile from deep point does well to reach there and get his left hand to the ball as he dives. He deflects it on to his body, which deflects the ball back towards the boundary
Ingraqkm shuffles across and works Gul from middle and leg for one towards square leg
slow off cutter and Duminy does not spot it and has an airy waft. The ball bounces twice before carrying to Haider.
another off cutter, slightly quicker, and closer to JP's body, who is again beaten by the deviation as it grips and deviates away from off stump.
slower ball, drifts down he pads and Ingram sends it along the way for four runs, very fine. Called leg-byes. Three to win.
fastish lifter at 140 kph and Ingram looks to play the Gilchrist upper cut/glide. Does not make contact though and it thuds into Haider's gloves
very fast, very short and very wide down the leg. And I feel very sorry for Haider who leaps across like a goallie, to his right, to haul that missile in,
141.7 kph and Ingram again has a flirt at it after getting half forward as it buzzes past outside off.
143.9 kph this time as Shoaib steams in outside off. Ingram gets bat on it finally, but can't get it past point
140.8 kph and on the pads, Ingram adjusts as it lands back of a length and works it to midwicket
pushes him back with another short ball, this time Ingram handles it well by getting back in the crease and riding the bounce., Dropped to the off side for one
122 kph slower ball, cutting across from off stump as Ingram looks to dap it square for one on the off side., Straight to point
looks for another delicate glide and fails to make contact outside off
and he's finally perfected the shot. Ingram gets the upper cut away nicely and comfortably over the infield for four. SA have compketed their 10th successive ODI win.
